title: Game not properly hiding desktop menu.
body:
For a lack of a better title.

Yesterday I got my computer (an ASUS Republic of Gamers gaming laptop) hooked up to a flat screen TV: the only way I can use it since the laptop screen is busted, and after playing the new Dark Star game mode (which my team won by the way) I noticed throughout it that it wasn't fully full-screen-the desktop menu bar still shows. Going into a custom game I tried all the resolutions in full screen, windowed and borderless and nothing fixed the problem. I have a feeling that something in the latest patch caused this because I've never had this issue before today.

Any help would be greatly appreciated, thanks.

replies.body: It might be happening because the resolution isn't adjusting properly to the tv. This fix may not make much sense, but we've seen a lot of players able to fix that task bar issue by running a [**clean boot**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201761974-Bug-Splat-and-Game-Crashes#wq7) of Windows. Let me know if that does the trick ^_^!

> It might be happening because the resolution isn't adjusting properly to the tv. This fix may not make much sense, but we've seen a lot of players able to fix that task bar issue by running a [**clean boot**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201761974-Bug-Splat-and-Game-Crashes#wq7) of Windows. Let me know if that does the trick ^_^!

As it turned out my computer had updates that needed to be installed, so I just restarted the computer and after just now testing everything in a custom game everything seems to be fine now, so thanks.
